intro: Senecio longilinguae, commonly known as the narrow-leaved senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features slender, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
